Authors: Jize Xu, Xiaodong Yu, Wei Zhao
Title:
Infundibulicybe trachyspora , a new species from northeastern
China based on morphology and molecular phylogeny
Keywords:
clitocyboid species, ITS sequence, nrLSU sequence,
taxonomy
Abstract:
Infundibulicybe trachyspora is described as a new species
from northeastern China. The species is characterized by its clitocyboid
to omphalioid habit, carneous, greyish yellow to brownish pileus, brown
to dark reddish brown, longitudinally fibrillose-striate stipe,
non-amyloid, non-smooth spores, the absence of cystidia and the presence
of clamp connections. A comprehensive description of the species is
provided along with photo-illustration and comparisons with phenetically
similar and phylogenetically related species. The nuclear ribosomal
internal transcribed spacer (ITS) region and the nuclear large subunit
rDNA (nrLSU) region of the new species was sequenced and analyzed. The
phylogenetic analysis supported the novelty of the species and its
placement within the genus. Furthermore, a discussion on the proposal to
establish a new section is made, and a key is provided for the
Infundibulicybe species as reported from China.
